abstract: Should religious belief be allowed to trump public responsibility?
snippet: Should religious belief be allowed to trump public responsibility?
lead_paragraph: The refusal by an upstate New York town clerk to sign marriage licenses for same-sex couples, as reported on the front page of The Times last week, can be seen simply as a discordant footnote to the march of marriage equality in New York State. But seen in a broader context, it is also more than that.
